description: Dive into "Capture El Nido: A Photographer's Paradise" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Capture El Nido: A Photographer's Paradise

places.generalDescription: Las Caba√±as Beach, also known as Marimegmeg Beach, is a must-visit destination in El Nido, Palawan. This picturesque beach offers stunning sunset views and a relaxed atmosphere. It features a beautiful stretch of sand bordered by coconut plantations, providing the perfect setting for unwinding and enjoying the natural beauty. The beach is lined with bars and restaurants where visitors can savor drinks and snacks while taking in the remarkable scenery.

sources.snippet: If there‚Äôs the mandatory kayaking photo to kick off your beach pictures checklist, there‚Äôs the classic, sentimental sunset shot to close it off. Las Cabanas, over a half-hour drive from El Nido town is one of the best places to catch the golden hour glow. Grab a cocktail at one of the beach bars and watch the sky do its magic.
sources.shortName: The 10 Most Instagrammable Spots In El Nido Philippines

sources.snippet: Las Cabanas Beach is the perfect spot to relax and unwind while watching stunning sunsets in El Nido. With its long stretch of golden sand and clear waters, it is located just a short tricycle ride from El Nido town proper, Las Cabanas Beach boasts plenty of bars and restaurants along the beachfront, making it the ideal place to enjoy a refreshing cocktail or a delicious meal after a day of island hopping. Private Tours Palawan ‚Ç± 25,020.00
sources.shortName: Top 10 Must-Visit Places in El Nido, Palawan

sources.snippet: Perfect for unwinding, Las Cabanas Beach is known for its laid-back vibe, beachfront bars, and stunning sunset views. The beach is a popular spot for relaxing with a drink in hand while enjoying the calming sound of waves. But for those seeking a bit of adventure, the famous zipline activity that runs across the ocean is a must-try, offering a heart-pounding ride with panoramic views of the sparkling sea below.
sources.shortName: 14 Best El Nido Town Tourist Spots & Things to Do in Palawan Island

sources.snippet: Located at the end of your walk down Corong Corong beach is a beautiful restaurant with panoramic views of the ocean and islands  called Las Cabanas Beach resort. We ate here on our last night, be sure to get a table in front of the sunset and be sure to have views of the many tourists taking selfies. Check out our Las Cabanas sunset time-lapse HERE at 6:30 into the video.
sources.shortName: El Nido Philippines the Most BEAUTIFUL place in the WORLD!

sources.snippet: As well as Nacpan Beach, Las Cabanas Beach is one of the best beaches in El Nido. To get here, you‚Äôll have to walk through Vanilla Beach, a brand-new shopping area. We love to spend the whole day at Las Cabanas Beach, where we can relax in the cosy bean bags at Beach Shack and sip a drink while watching the sun go down.
sources.siteName: Mik Simons - A journey of life
sources.shortName: 12 Awesome things to do in El Nido Philippines

sources.snippet: This beach is famous for one of the most spectacular sunsets in the Philippines. It is a very quiet place till 5 pm when people from all around El Nido come to experience this amazing show of mother nature. It almost seems that the whole of El Nido moves to Las Cabanas for sunset and leaves as it becomes dark.
sources.shortName: Where to stay in El Nido

sources.snippet: Las Cabanas Beach offers everything you could want in a Philippine island beach: white sands, clear water, and palm trees lining the thing. However, Las Cabanas Beach has one extra feature that stands out: a zipline. From the beach, you‚Äôll embark on a 10-minute climb up some stairs to reach the landing point.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in El Nido (the Philippines)

sources.snippet: Las Cabanas Beach is one of the most popular and developed beaches in El Nido. It is great for sunbathing, swimming, and having drinks or food at one of the many beach bars, and it‚Äôs the best beach to watch the sunset. The tricycle fare is 150 PHP (2.60 USD) for two persons from town.
sources.siteName: Salt in our Hair Travel Blog
sources.shortName: 10 Best Things To Do in El Nido, Palawan (2025 Travel Guide)
23 Amazing Photos That Makes You Want To Visit El Nido, Palawan, Philippines 2021

places.name: Las Caba√±as Beach

reviews.text: Las Caba√±as is a really beautiful and huge beach! It is perfect for suntanning or a leisurely stroll along the shore. There are a couple of restaurants at the beach that offer scenic views while dining. Love the atmosphere and vibes!
If you are in Elnido, you must visit this beach. During the sunset so beautiful. There is some shops, bars and nice restaurant. You can go there by tuk-tuk ( tricycle ) 10 min from center.

Very nice beach  especially  to sit and watch the sunset . There are also coffee bars to drink eat swim and enjoy the sunset .most of the bars doesn't accept a card . The beach  has many rocks inside so better to watch or else you will need sea shoes .

places.address: Taytay - El Nido National Hwy, El Nido, Palawan, Philippines

places.generalDescription: Nacpan Beach, situated near El Nido in Palawan, Philippines, is a picturesque and serene destination that offers a peaceful retreat in a coastal paradise. Accessible by a 45-minute motorbike ride through dirt roads, this seven-kilometer stretch of undeveloped white sand beach meets the sky-blue transparent waters, creating an idyllic tropical setting.

sources.snippet: Over a half-hour drive from El Nido town proper is arguably one of the most beautiful beaches in the area. Because it‚Äôs a bit of a drive from town, a portion of which runs over some bumpy roads, Nacpan Beach doesn‚Äôt get overly crowded with tourists (passerby-free photos!). It‚Äôs a stunning stretch of fine, white sand, backed by rows of coconut trees.
sources.shortName: The 10 Most Instagrammable Spots In El Nido Philippines

sources.snippet: Nacpan Beach is a true gem that should be on every beach lover‚Äôs bucket list. With its long stretch of powdery golden sand, crystal-clear blue waters, and coconut palm trees lining the shore, it‚Äôs no surprise that Nacpan Beach is one of the must-see attractions in the area. What makes Nacpan Beach even more special is that it‚Äôs one of Palawan‚Äôs best-hidden beaches and is relatively tourist-free, offering visitors a sense of seclusion and tranquility that‚Äôs hard to find in other crowded beaches.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Must-Visit Places in El Nido, Palawan

sources.snippet: One of the most famous beaches in the area, Nacpan Beach, is 4 KM long and has stunning clear blue water and powdery white sand. There are restaurants and vendors lining the main portion of the beach, with sun chairs for rent at a few establishments. To get there, there is a shuttle to and from El Nido Town to Nacpan Beach every hour with the first trip to the beach at 8am and the last trip back to El Nido at 7pm daily.
sources.shortName: El Nido Philippines Travel Guide

sources.snippet: Nacpan Beach is one of the most popular and most beautiful beaches in the Philippines. While it does not have white sand like Boracay, Nacpan Beach offers an equally amazing island experience. It features a 4-kilometer stretch of cream-colored sand, hundreds of swaying coconut trees, a fishing village, clear aqua water with small surfable waves.
sources.shortName: El Nido Palawan 2022 Guide: Tourist Spots | Hotels

sources.snippet: As you can see upon arrival, neither the beaches of Corong nor that of El Nido's town are like those of the Bacuit archipelago. To take a bath, you will have to dodge boats and waste discarded in them. To enjoy a good beach, you will have to rent a motorcycle and go 1 hour away from the town to Nacpan beach without taking a tour in Bangka.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable places in El Nido

sources.snippet: A great 45-minute motorbike ride from town takes you to the 4-kilometer-long beach with coconut trees along the entire coastline. The tip of Nacpan splits into Calitang Beach, where small beach shacks sell fresh coconuts, seafood, and beach beds. Nacpan can handle a lot of people, so it never feels too crowded.
sources.siteName: Salt in our Hair Travel Blog
sources.shortName: 10 Best Things To Do in El Nido, Palawan (2025 Travel Guide)

sources.snippet: For those seeking a laid-back experience in El Nido town, Nacpan Beach is a must-visit. This long stretch of golden sand and calm waters is ideal for sunbathing, swimming, and strolling along the shore. Nacpan is part of the famed Twin Beaches of El Nido town, sharing its coastline with Calitang Beach.
sources.shortName: 14 Best El Nido Town Tourist Spots & Things to Do in Palawan Island

sources.snippet: It has a west-facing isthmus of sorts that offers a killer view at any time of the day. What more during the golden hour. But if you're not willing to take the 40-minute trip north of El Nido town, just take a sunset cruise in El Nido bay, just a few clicks west of Miniloc and Entalula Island.
sources.shortName: an Island Hopping Engagement Session in El Nido Palawan Philippines

sources.snippet: Nacpan Beach is about 45 minutes North of El Nido town, but absolutely worth the trek over. Imagine you + 4km of powdery white sand beach. Order a cocktail (and some great bar snacks) from Nacpan Sunmai Restaurant, and spend the most perfect day by the beach.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Must-see Places in El Nido Philippines
10 Most Instagrammable places in El Nido

sources.snippet: A 40 minute motorbike journey from El Nido Proper is Nacpan Beach, the perfect location for exploring and adventuring in a diverse array of landscapes. Trees are to be climbed.
sources.shortName: 40 Awesome Photos of El Nido, Palawan
The most Instagrammable places in the Philippines

places.name: Nacpan Beach

reviews.text: Such a nice stretch of high quality white sand beach with barely any crowd.  Top notch for swimming with calm, warm, shallow waters and a spot for Turtle hatchlings during its season.  The best part is the view of the sunsets!!!

Beautiful beach which is around 35 minutes drive from city of El Nido. Lovely sand, nice (clean) and warm water, and a lot of space to relax, so it's not overcrowded like some other beaches. If You are in El nido for few days, it's a must!
Definitely one of my favorite beaches I've been to!!! The water was so calm and clear. Nice place to just chill and relax without the crowd.

places.generalDescription: Big Lagoon is a narrow waterway with striking blue waters surrounded by dark limestone cliffs. The lagoon offers a stunning and serene experience, especially when the crowds have dispersed, allowing visitors to appreciate its beauty in solitude. Cruising through the Big Lagoon provides breathtaking views of towering limestone rocks that enclose the area, creating a picturesque setting.

sources.snippet: A trip to El Nido almost demands a mandatory kayaking photo. And the best places to score these are within Bacuit Bay‚Äôs exquisite lagoons. Here, karst landscapes serve as an astonishing backdrop, and your bright yellow kayak will strikingly contrast the beautiful turquoise waters.
sources.shortName: The 10 Most Instagrammable Spots In El Nido Philippines

sources.snippet: The Big Lagoon, located in El Nido, is a iconic destination that every traveler should add to their itinerary. With its clear turquoise waters, towering limestone cliffs, and lush green vegetation, the Big Lagoon is one of the most photographed places in the area. As part of El Nido Tour A, the Big Lagoon offers visitors the chance to explore the lagoon‚Äôs natural beauty and take stunning photos that are sure to impress.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Must-Visit Places in El Nido, Palawan

sources.snippet: You can opt to rent a kayak or hire a boat to take you to the Big Lagoon. When the current isn‚Äôt gliding you along, you‚Äôll navigate around towering walls of jagged rock that look like they‚Äôre CGI imposed until you come into a little inlet with bright sea foam green water with a little beach ahead. The lagoon is magical.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in El Nido (the Philippines)
10 Most Instagrammable places in El Nido

sources.snippet: If these two lagoons are not enough for you, you can visit the Big Lagoon, too. You will be happy with what you see and what to do in El Nido. This one is less shocking.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable places in El Nido

sources.snippet: ('em coconut trees! Hey, look! I'm in the Philippines!) Helicopter Island for a breathtaking view of iconic Cadlao Island, and Big Lagoon for it's Big...
sources.shortName: an Island Hopping Engagement Session in El Nido Palawan Philippines

sources.snippet: To make sure you can use one without breaking any rules (or annoying other people) try to go as early as possible to places like the Big Lagoon.
sources.shortName: The most Instagrammable places in the Philippines

places.name: Big Lagoon

reviews.text: One of a kind experience of rowing yourself towards the lagoon. Kayak is only 300 pesos for 2 person. It became hard for us to enter the lagoon as the wind was blowing us outward. However, we managed to go inside but we were so exhausted üòÖ Still a good experience though
The turquoise water and tall cliffs are such a beautiful sight. We loved kayaking around the lagoon and exploring all the peaceful spots. It's a perfect place for taking photos and just relaxing.

If you dont know swimming but yet you want to walk a around in the water, big lagoon is the place.

Its the highlight to Tour A from El Nido island hopping. Try to enjoy in a weekday to avoid crowd. Kayaking is so much fun there. It has small kayaking trail inside which i did, dont miss it to get some extra fun.

The lagoon very nicely and strickly preserved by the govt. and this is very much appreciable.

places.generalDescription: Embark on the 'Sea Quest' island-hopping tour in El Nido for an unforgettable exploration of its 45 islands and islets. With options for group or private tours, you can visit stunning locations like Big Lagoon, Small Lagoon, Shimizu Island, Secret Lagoon, and 7th Commando Beach. This popular activity offers a chance to capture breathtaking photos and videos while enjoying buffet lunches and drinks amidst the natural beauty of the Philippines.

sources.snippet: On tour A, I visited Big Lagoon, Small Lagoon, had lunch on Shimizu Island, discovered Secret Lagoon, and relaxed under the palm trees of 7th Commando Beach. One of the most popular island-hopping tours in the Philippines!. COST Group tours are around PHP 1300 + PHP 200 per person environmental fee (including buffet lunch + drinks) Private tours are around PHP 4500 for a boat + guide + PHP 200 per person environmental fee (no lunch or drinks included)
sources.siteName: Mik Simons - A journey of life
sources.shortName: 12 Awesome things to do in El Nido Philippines

sources.snippet: A protected area called Bacuit Bay, hosting 45 paradise islands, has been named one of the most beautiful destinations in the entire world. Tours A, B, C & D all visit different islands, and all tours are stunning. Stunning lagoons, movie-like islands, and beautiful wildlife ‚Äì you‚Äôll find it all in these island hopping tours in El Nido.
sources.siteName: Salt in our Hair Travel Blog
sources.shortName: 10 Best Things To Do in El Nido, Palawan (2025 Travel Guide)

sources.snippet: Each tour offering a set of 5+ beaches, islands, lagoons and snorkelling spots. A group tour can be joined at various establishments throughout El Nido Town, however these boat tours often have 20+ people on each boat. We personally love seeing the beauty of each place in a small group or on a private tour.
sources.shortName: El Nido Philippines Travel Guide

sources.snippet: By far the biggest draw of El Nido Palawan would have to be the incredible island hopping boat tours that can be done here. The tours are split into 4 different areas of coverage: A, B, C, and D. You can find a summary of each of them below.
sources.shortName: El Nido Palawan Island Travel Guide For The Philippines
These Local Celebrities Agree That Palawan Is One Of The Most Insta-Worthy Islands In The World
Top 10 Must-Visit Places in El Nido, Palawan

places.name: El Nido Tours "Sea Quest" - island hopping and expeditions to Coron.

reviews.text:
I can't say enough good things about our 3-day, 2-night expedition! From the moment we stepped on board, the tour guide and the entire crew made us feel so welcome and taken care of. They were all so friendly and created such a fun, happy atmosphere for the whole trip.

The scenery was just breathtaking. We snorkeled in so many beautiful spots and relaxed on pristine white sand beaches. Getting to walk through a classic Filipino village was a really special experience. I was also impressed with how clean and neat our cabins were. One of the best parts was the food-it was delicious, and they made sure we never went hungry, with plenty of snacks and drinks always available. The evening karaoke with all the guests and crew was hilarious and such a great way to bond!

Our group of 12 felt like the perfect size for the boat, creating a nice, intimate vibe. The only downside was that one cabin didn't have a fan, which made it uncomfortably hot for sleeping. Aside from that, it was a truly wonderful trip, and I would do it again in a heartbeat.

Amazing 3 days trip from El Nido to Coron. The crew onboard was very kind, helpful and at our service at all times. Chef cooked amazing (and loads!) of local / homemade food. The camps were very clean and well equipped. We saw beautiful beaches and crystal clear water, nice snorkeling spots and also karaoke sessions üôåüèΩ.
We had some delay for departure the second day due to technical issues (I mention that we were on a beautiful island, not very disturbing to wait there).   To apologize and make it up to us, Sea Quest offered to each guest an extra day of choice on a boat expedition. We got the ultimate tour 2 days after, lunch, beers and kayaks included , totally free of charge. Amazing service, thanks again guys, you made our trip wonderful

The cruise from Coron to El Nido was a great experience overall. Everything was very well organized, and the scenery along the way was absolutely stunning.

The accommodation was simple but clean and comfortable, which suited the adventure-style of the trip. The food was a real highlight - fresh, tasty, and varied throughout the cruise.

The crew was kind and welcoming, although we would have appreciated more background information or stories about the places we visited - a bit more context would have made the experience even richer.

The boat was fully booked (30 guests), so it did feel a bit tight at times, especially during meals or when everyone was on board.

Despite those small points, it was a very enjoyable trip and one I would definitely recommend. A beautiful way to explore this part of the Philippines!

places.address: 597X+WCQ, Philippines, Purok Bagong Pag-Asa, National Highway, Barangay Buena Suerte, El Nido, 5313 Palawan, Philippines

places.generalDescription: Papaya Beach is a stunning destination in El Nido, Palawan, offering breathtaking views of the island and a vast sandy expanse. While it can get busy with tourists during the day, the crowds tend to thin out as sunset approaches, providing a more serene experience. The beach features fine white sand and lush rainforest surroundings, making it an ideal spot for relaxation and enjoying nature's beauty. Visitors can also find amenities such as a bar and restroom facilities for added convenience.

sources.shortName: The most Instagrammable places in the Philippines

places.name: Papaya Beach

reviews.text: One of my favorite beaches in El Nido. I would highly recommend you rent a kayak and visit at your own pace! We spent a whole day here relaxing. During that time you'll see boats tours come and go, but I feel like those on the boat tours do not get to enjoy it as much.

We were here on 27th of December 2024. Beautiful fine sand, water was perfect - not too hot or too cold. A nice surprise for us was that there were lots of butterflies on these flowering trees. In the water that's not too deep, we even saw many clownfish. I was very happy as I'm not a good swimmer and still panic in deep water even with life jacket on. But here, I could snorkel for a long time in relatively shallow water with lots of sea life to see. The water was quite calm as well so it's a good place for beginners to snorkel. We hired kayak for 600php from Corong-corong beach (no time limit) so you can take your time here in Papaya beach, Lapus lapus beach and Seven commando beach. The only downside at Papaya beach was that there were lots of small jellyfish so I felt a small sting here and there but no harm done.

Another great beach to kayak to from Coring Corong beach. It can be a bit choppy if the wind is up. But their is a vendor on the beach that sells cold drinks and snacks.
The snorkelling is fantastic  nice corals,fish and turtles. Lots of shade and silica white sand with a dramatic cliff and rainforest backdrop. Highly recommend visiting this beach!

places.generalDescription: Lio Beach in El Nido, Palawan is a stunning tropical paradise with palm-fringed shores and upscale resorts. It's known for water sports, surfing, and kayaking at Big Lagoon. The beach is secluded, clean, and offers a serene atmosphere with the sound of waves gently crashing on the sand. Seda Lio features a large pool overlooking the beach where visitors can enjoy cocktails from the pool bar while lounging in sunbeds.

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs an area located next to the Airport, very practical if you fly in for just 2/3 days. There are a few resorts and hotels with beach bars along most of the beach, all at a reasonable price I must say. This is where I also had my best internet connections, otherwise always so unbearably slow in all of the other areas.
sources.shortName: Where to stay in El Nido

sources.snippet: Lio Beach is an emerging beach, it is still quiet, but that will certainly change in the next few years. Hip cafes and modern souvenir shops line Lio Beach. You will also find a quiet place to relax on the long, beautiful beach.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable places in El Nido

sources.snippet: Lio Beach El Nido is a quick 15 minute ride from El Nido town. The beach offers private shuttles from the town, check with your hotel or hostel for timings. We loved how the beach was not crowded.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Must-see Places in El Nido Philippines

places.name: Lio Beach

reviews.text: Lio Beach is the best beach of El Nido in my opinion. It is a quiet and clean beach with free parking available. There is plenty of shade from the palm trees and a few good restaurants nearby to grab something to eat or drink. Great place to relax and watch the sunset.

It is simply beautiful and quiet. You could not ask more from a beach. Crowd is just enough, no one rowdy and you can get photos like mine easily without needing to wake up too early or go at weird hours.

The sand is not super fine but my standard for that is pretty high. The water is clear, and you don't know it but it just a few meters ahead of you people can go swimming.

Lio Beach should be considered a national treasure with a stunning sandy beach running from coastal jungle to jungle hills. The jetty in the middle of the beach is a great landmark and helps tie it all together. The local bars and vendors are all beach themed and it's a great vibe overall. Well worth a trip if you're in the area.
Almost feels like something out of pirates of the Caribbean

places.address: Lio Beach (1,290.12 mi, 5310 Lio, El Nido, 5310 Palawan, Philippines

places.generalDescription: Seven Commandos Beach is a stunning destination in El Nido, featuring serene white-sand shores, clear turquoise waters, and picturesque rock formations. The beach is surrounded by coconut trees and a massive limestone cliff, creating a postcard-perfect setting reminiscent of Moana's island. Accessible only by boat, it has become a popular stop for island hopping tours in the area. Legend has it that the beach was named after seven Japanese soldiers who sought refuge there after World War II.

sources.snippet: If you choose to go on the island hopping Tour A, this pristine stop will be on your day‚Äôs itinerary. Though you will likely be in the company of fellow tourists due to this beach‚Äôs popularity, it proves to be a small price to pay for a dazzling beach and shoreline, and lined up coconut trees that make for a scenic background. Try to go on leaner hours of the day to avoid the crowds.
sources.shortName: The 10 Most Instagrammable Spots In El Nido Philippines

sources.snippet: A favorite among beach lovers, Seven Commandos Beach is a long stretch of white sand bordered by lush greenery and crystal-clear waters. Legend has it that the beach was named after seven soldiers who were stranded there during World War II. Today, it stands as one of El Nido town's most beautiful beaches, perfect for lounging and enjoying the sun. Seven Commandos Beach is also part of the El Nido Tour A island-hopping itinerary, along with other iconic spots like Big Lagoon and Secret Lagoon.
sources.shortName: 14 Best El Nido Town Tourist Spots & Things to Do in Palawan Island

sources.snippet: Seven Commandos Beach is a stunning tropical destination that every beach lover should experience when visiting El Nido. With its white sand and crystal-clear, warm waters, the beach offers the perfect setting for swimming, sunbathing, and relaxation. As the final stop on El Nido Tour A, Seven Commandos Beach is a popular destination for tourists looking to soak up the area‚Äôs natural beauty and enjoy a day at the beach.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Must-Visit Places in El Nido, Palawan

sources.snippet: Visit the island where 7 Japanese commandos lived for a period of time near the end of WWII. The names of the soldiers are said to be written on stones around the island, but not much else is known about these soldiers, including what happened to them.
sources.shortName: Things To Do In El Nido Palawan Philippines

sources.snippet: 7 Commandos Beach features a long stretch of fine white sand that makes an absolute paradise for beach lovers who not only want to take a dip or snorkel, but also want to take a rest, sunbathe, and play along the shore.
sources.shortName: El Nido Palawan 2022 Guide: Tourist Spots | Hotels

sources.snippet: Seven Commandos Beach was the first island stop on Tour A. Believe it or not the tour got better from here on in.
sources.shortName: 40 Awesome Photos of El Nido, Palawan

places.name: Seven Commandos Beach

reviews.text: Seven Commando Beach is a great spot to unwind while in El Nido. It has soft white sand, clear blue water, and a peaceful atmosphere that's perfect for swimming or just relaxing. There's even a small sari-sari store on the beach where you can grab drinks or snacks, which is super convenient. It's a nice stop during an island-hopping tour and definitely worth visiting!

This beach has been chosen as one of the most beautiful beaches in the world a few times. The beach is extended, and  there are some basic amenities for tourists. Consider that many tours bring people here and it can get very crowded. Nonetheless, that would not deter you from appreciating the beauty of the beach.

We visited this beach as a part of tour A.

It's just beautiful and snorkeling here is also great. I saw a squid, a lion fish (for the first time) and other fishes. The water is clear and the beach is beautiful ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•

places.generalDescription: Nestled behind a small cave, the Secret Lagoon is a popular spot for tourists seeking an adventure. It can be accessed through various island hopping tours that also cover other attractions in El Nido. Upon reaching the lagoon, visitors are greeted by stunning turquoise waters surrounded by towering limestone walls. The secluded ambiance adds to the allure of this hidden gem, offering a peaceful escape from the bustling tourist spots.

sources.snippet: After leaving the boat docked on a beach, you can head towards a small hole that opens in the limestone rock, as if it is a door to another dimension, to a blue dimension intense turquoise with greenish touches, as if a paint bottle had been spilled in the water. When crossing the small hole, your gaze will be lost in the infinity of the rock walls that almost touch the sky. If you are lucky to be alone in this haven of peace, you can only hear the echo of your voices.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable places in El Nido

sources.snippet: No trip to El Nido would be complete without experiencing the magical beauty of the Secret Lagoon in Miniloc Island. Tucked away behind dramatic rock walls, this secluded lagoon boasts a secret beach and crystal-clear waters. To access the Secret Lagoon, you must slip through a small opening  in the rock, adding an element of adventure and excitement to your visit.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Must-Visit Places in El Nido, Palawan

sources.snippet: The southern bay of Miniloc Island has some of the most remarkable stone structures around El Nido. Large pieces of limestone rise out of the sea, forming thin curtains of black rock. Some of these rocks have small holes in them that make you wonder how they were formed.
sources.shortName: Things To Do In El Nido Palawan Philippines

sources.snippet: Secret Lagoon is literally one of Miniloc Island‚Äôs best-kept secrets as it is hidden by massive karst cliffs. To get there, you‚Äôll crawl through a small hole to get through and once you‚Äôre inside, you‚Äôll discover the stunning Secret Lagoon‚Äôs cool, blue waters.
sources.shortName: El Nido Palawan 2022 Guide: Tourist Spots | Hotels

sources.snippet: The not so secret lagoon now that El Nido is so wildly popular!. It‚Äôs a gorgeous spot though, the lagoon is tiny and accessed via a hole in the cliff side (it‚Äôs easy to get in). It does get hugely busy and is so small that it can‚Äôt really take the crowds.
sources.shortName: The most Instagrammable places in the Philippines

places.name: Secret Lagoon

reviews.text: It was such a unique and memorable experience entering the Secret Lagoon! We had to free dive through a narrow cave to reach the hidden waters. The view was really beautiful!

üåä Secret Lagoon, El Nido ‚Äì A Hidden Gem with a Bit of a Challenge

Our visit to the Secret Lagoon was truly unforgettable, though getting there wasn't easy. During our trip, the tide was high and the waves were quite strong, making the entrance a bit tricky. You have to kneel or crouch down to squeeze through the narrow opening, and I even got a small wound on my knees along the way.

Once inside, the lagoon itself was smaller than expected, and there wasn't much space to stand , probably because of the tide at the time. But despite the challenging entry, the experience was still magical. The hidden beauty of the place, surrounded by towering limestone cliffs, made it all worth it.

It's a raw, natural adventure, not the most comfortable, but definitely memorable. Just be prepared and wear proper footwear!

We were very fortunate to enter the secret lagoon when it was empty and really loved it. You have to enter it through a small hole in the rocks. Best to wear water shoes.
There was a quaint beach which was fun to hang out in. There was a very cute cat who was a major attraction!
This is a part of the Tour A

places.generalDescription: Small Lagoon is a picturesque inlet surrounded by limestone walls, making it a popular spot for kayaking, swimming, and cliff diving. Visitors can also enjoy snorkeling in the nearby secret beach. There are various accommodation options available in the surrounding neighborhoods, catering to different preferences and budgets. Additionally, there are numerous local restaurants offering a wide range of cuisines from seafood to vegan dishes. Visitors can also indulge in shopping for souvenirs at bargain prices.

sources.snippet: Another divine photo-op presents itself at El Nido‚Äôs Small Lagoon. Just as its ‚Äúbigger‚Äù counterpart, towering limestones and gorgeous blue waters make this a fantastic setting for your next Instagram upload. Whether you choose to linger around the lagoon entrance on your bangka or decide to rent a kayak to enter and explore its hidden nooks, you‚Äôre bound to get a brilliant shot.
sources.shortName: The 10 Most Instagrammable Spots In El Nido Philippines
10 Most Instagrammable places in El Nido

sources.snippet: Even with the first visit's excitement, you can head to another one of the region's Instagrammable places‚Äîsmall Lagoon. You can rent a kayak to cross another door again, this time bigger and in deeper water. When crossing the door, the sensation will be similar.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable places in El Nido

sources.snippet: The entrance to the Small Lagoon is just a narrow gap in-between two big rocks. It feels super secret, which is half the appeal!. When you make it through via kayak or hired boat, throw on your snorkel and get in the water!
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in El Nido (the Philippines)

places.name: Small Lagoon

reviews.text:
We took a private boat out there.
I got on a kayak and got my drone in the sky.
The location and place is 10/10 wow ü§©
Gets a little crowded between 10am-2pm but not too much. Kayaking here is fun. My 2 year old enjoyed the kayaking and swimming here.
Such a beautiful place! Amazing rock formations and very clear water. Awesome guide was informative and funny! Did a tour that included a great lunch with seafood.

Amazing place ! Take a canoe to enjoy more the experience üòç

Insta : @carinowanderers

places.address: 584C+GHR, Miniloc Island, El Nido, Palawan, Philippines

places.generalDescription: Cadlao Lagoon, located on the far side of Cadlao Island in the Bacuit archipelago, is a stunning natural wonder that lives up to its name, which means smile. Accessible via Tour D or by renting a kayak and following the shoreline of Cadlao Island, this lagoon offers calm green waters surrounded by beautiful limestone karsts. The journey to the lagoon includes passing through choppy waves and rain but rewards visitors with a tranquil pool of turquoise water.

sources.snippet: Located on the far side of the large Cadlao Island that you can see from El Nido Town is the lagoon by the same name. This is the highlight stop on Tour D, along with a few other nice beaches on the island on the way to the lagoon. This is really the only tour you might be able to do independently by renting a kayak and following the shoreline of  Cadlao Island.
sources.shortName: Things To Do In El Nido Palawan Philippines
10 Most Instagrammable places in El Nido

sources.snippet: It features locations that I haven't been to - Bukal Beach, Cadlao Lagoon, Pasandigan Beach, Paradise Beach, all of which are in Cadlao Island, the poster boy of Bacuit Bay - and my new personal fave Ipil Beach. I've been to most of the islands in Tours A, B and C.
sources.shortName: El Nido Palawan Philippines Travel Couple Photography

places.name: Cadlao Lagoon

reviews.text: Kayak must rented(300php) to visit these lagoon. Also possible to swim, but there are big rocks underwater. Water is very blue, because of fresh water.  No toilet!

Absolutely stunning spot in El Nido! The water in Cadlao Lagoon is crystal clear with beautiful shades of blue and green. Perfect for kayaking or just relaxing and taking in the view. It's less crowded than other lagoons, which makes it feel peaceful and special. The limestone cliffs surrounding the lagoon are breathtaking. If you're in El Nido, don't miss this hidden gem. Highly recommended!
Nice spot to visit, but not sure why they  force you to rent a kayak as one could easily swim this from where the boats park

places.address: 687W+V5G, Unnamed Road, El Nido, Palawan, Philippines

places.generalDescription: Big Lagoon is a must-see attraction in El Nido, located within Miniloc Island. It is famous for its towering limestone cliffs surrounding a turquoise blue body of water where visitors can kayak their way inside. Although popular among tourists, renting a kayak allows you to explore deep inside the lagoon where big boats cannot enter, offering a picture-perfect moment with sparkling waters and impressive limestone formations.

sources.snippet: One of the most iconic destinations in El Nido town, the  Big Lagoon is famous for its crystal-clear turquoise waters framed by towering limestone cliffs. The journey into Big Lagoon feels almost mystical as you paddle or cruise through the narrow entrance. As the lagoon opens up, you're met with a stunning vista of still waters reflecting the surrounding karst formations.
sources.shortName: 14 Best El Nido Town Tourist Spots & Things to Do in Palawan Island

places.name: Big Lagoon

reviews.text: Kayaking through the Big Lagoon is a fun and breathtaking experience, with stunning limestone formations all around. Exploring hidden gems like the secret cave adds excitement to the tour. While it can be tiring, especially after a full day, the beauty and adventure make it absolutely worth it!
Well worth the visit. 300 pasoes for a kayak for 2 people. Most people only go to the entrance, but if you kakak to the back of the lagoon it get mush quieter. There was some jelly fish around.

If you are going to Elnido, you should definitely visit the big lagoon. Daily tours  go to there, tour A. Tours depart at 9.30 in the morning. We bought a private tour. There were 2 of us. We paid a total of 12,000 pp. We also paid 300 pp for kayaking. The reason we bought a private tour was that it departed earlier in the morning and we wanted to see the big lagoon when it was quiet before anyone else arrived. We also wanted to visit the island we wanted on the private tour. We left the land at 08.30 in the morning. First, we went to the big lagoon. The boats anchor outside the lagoon. You need to rent kayaks to get inside. We rented kayaks for 2 people and there were very few people there as we wanted and it was worth it. It is a real natural wonder. We spent about 1.5 hours there. Since it was very hot even at that hour, I recommend wearing a hat, sunglasses, sunscreen and a rash guard if you wish.  If you want to swim, there is a shallow area inside, you can swim there.

places.generalDescription: Miniloc Island is a stunning destination with lush rainforests, pristine white-sand beaches, and a diverse marine ecosystem. Recently recognized as the world's favorite island, it offers an unparalleled coastal village experience at El Nido Resorts. The island is renowned for its rich marine wildlife and vibrant coral reefs, making it ideal for snorkeling and diving enthusiasts. Visitors can explore popular attractions such as the Big and Small Lagoons, Snake Island, and more through private tours.

sources.snippet: Pre wedding photography x @redsheepphotocinema featuring location photos of Lagen Island Resort and sandbar, the Big Lagoon in Miniloc Island, Helicopter Island before it became overcrowded and Pinagbuyutan Island in El Nido, Palawan, Philippines in Southeast Asia.
sources.shortName: an Island Hopping Engagement Session in El Nido Palawan Philippines

places.name: Miniloc Island

reviews.text: The view is great! Though activities are limited to beach viewing, swimming and snorkelling, you will still enjoy since the scenery is really amazing especially if you are a beach person.
A stunning spot in El Nido! The island has that postcard-perfect setting - limestone cliffs, clear waters, and amazing snorkeling right off the beach.

Sixth visit and still loving it!

Wonderful Staff
Great service
Good food

Even If one stays for four days,
One doesn't get bored.
ü•∞üòò

places.generalDescription: Shimizu Island is a small island in El Nido, known for its sandy beaches and clear waters that are perfect for snorkeling. The island got its name from a Japanese diver who died while diving in the underwater tunnel there. Although the tunnel is no longer accessible, the island's seawaters are still great for diving and swimming.

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre a snorkeling enthusiast, Shimizu Island is a must-visit destination during your trip to El Nido. Considered to be one of the best spots for snorkeling in the area, Shimizu Island offers crystal-clear waters teeming with a diverse array of colorful fish and coral formations. In addition to its underwater beauty, Shimizu Island also boasts secluded white beach and warm turquoise waters, making it the perfect destination for beach lovers and adventure seekers alike.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Must-Visit Places in El Nido, Palawan

sources.snippet: Shimizu Island is known for its pristine white sand and crystal-clear waters, making it a top destination for snorkeling and beach lounging. The surrounding coral reefs are teeming with colorful fish, making it a haven for underwater enthusiasts. Shimizu Island is also part of the El Nido Tour A island-hopping itinerary, along with Big Lagoon and Secret Lagoon.
sources.shortName: 14 Best El Nido Town Tourist Spots & Things to Do in Palawan Island

sources.snippet: Shimizu Island is one of the best snorkeling spots in El Nido. It is named after a late Japanese scuba diver who‚Äôs believed to have died in an underwater tunnel on this island. Through its crystal-clear waters, you can see an abundant reef inhabited by some of the world‚Äôs stunning corals and various fishes.
sources.shortName: El Nido Palawan 2022 Guide: Tourist Spots | Hotels

places.name: Shimizu Island

reviews.text:
Visiting this island was an absolute dream! The water was crystal clear, and the fine white sand felt like walking on clouds. Snorkeling here was incredible; I saw a vibrant array of fish and stunning coral formations. I highly recommend this destination for anyone seeking a tropical paradise experience.

For the best exploration, I suggest trying the El Nido Tour A. It's definitely worth it, offering unforgettable sights and experiences. Don't miss out on this gem when planning your trip!

Disclaimer: All photos belong to me and Why Go Philippines.

Trivia: Shimizu is a Japanese word for pure water.

Stopped here for lunch as part of Tour A. Awesome place for Scenic photos and Snorkeling little away from the island.

Most of the boats stop here for lunch... either in the island or on the boat. Prefer eating on the boat to avoid swarm of mosquitoes while eating.

One of the stop on TOUR A where you can swim and do snorkeling.

Calm water and beautiful panoramic view.

We stopped here to eat our buffet lunch.

places.address: 48Q9+GCV, Bacuit Bay, El Nido, Palawan, Philippines

places.generalDescription: Taraw Cliff, also known as Taraw Peak or Mt. Taraw, is a craggy limestone peak in El Nido that offers breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding villages and Bacuit Bay. Accessible via a suspension bridge and canopy walk, reaching the summit requires sturdy footwear and gloves provided by guides due to the steep and sharp limestone trail.

sources.snippet: Want your followers to know you haven‚Äôt traded in your active lifestyle for all-day beach idling?. Take an impressive photo atop Taraw Cliff overlooking the El Nido town and bay. While an easier (and safer) option is available through a canopy walk, the challenging route climbing up jagged limestones delivers the most rewarding views.
sources.shortName: The 10 Most Instagrammable Spots In El Nido Philippines

sources.snippet: If you're up for an adventure, Taraw Cliff offers one of the most exhilarating activities in El Nido. The steep climb requires strength and caution, but the reward at the top is a panoramic view of the town, lagoons, and surrounding islands that will take your breath away. Guided climbs like the canopy walk tour are highly recommended for safety, as the trail involves sharp rocks and steep inclines.
sources.shortName: 14 Best El Nido Town Tourist Spots & Things to Do in Palawan Island

sources.snippet: You can see the most beautiful views of El Nido Town from this spot. Tip: Go in the morning or during sunset, bring trainers and a water bottle, and get a guide. The best thing to do in El Nido if you like some adventure!
sources.siteName: Mik Simons - A journey of life
sources.shortName: 12 Awesome things to do in El Nido Philippines

sources.snippet: For this tough 2-hour hike, it is recommended to hire a guide and wear proper shoes before you climb up these sharp rocks. Once at the top, you will have an incredible view over the entire area.
sources.siteName: Salt in our Hair Travel Blog
sources.shortName: 10 Best Things To Do in El Nido, Palawan (2025 Travel Guide)

places.name: Taraw Cliff

reviews.text: Great place for a view of the bay. But you have to climb stairs and cross a suspension bridge to get there. You will wear climbing gear and protection and a helmet. Be prepared. Also, you have to pay and a house will be with you. The climb is only 15 to 20 minutes. But you'll have a nice view at the platform and can take some cool pics.

We only did the Canopy Walk which was 420 PHP per person.  They had the option to also do the other Dreamcatcher portion for an additional cost, where you crawl around on this rope netting hung across the cliff but we decided not to do that. You have to wear safety climbing type gear. Pretty good hike up into the limestone cliff. They have a metal staircase structure part of the way. The bottom half is a climb up rock and dirt stairs and oath that can be difficult for elderly people.  It takes about 15 minutes to hike to top and the view is great. There weren't many people there at the time so we had the place to ourselves.  I would say it is worthwhile to do this walk if you are in El Nido town and have an hour or so of free time.

Taraw Cliff is an absolute must-see when you're in El Nido! The climb is a bit challenging and requires a harness and helmet for safety, but it's all part of the adventure. A local guide will accompany you, and they're very friendly, knowledgeable, and the price is surprisingly affordable. Once you reach the top, you're rewarded with a breathtaking panoramic view of El Nido and its crystal-clear waters-totally worth the effort. If you're up for a little adventure and want to see El Nido from a whole new perspective, Taraw Cliff is the place to go!

places.generalDescription: El Nido Beach, also known as "The Nest," is a stunning destination in the northernmost tip of mainland Palawan. It serves as the gateway to the Bacuit archipelago, featuring white-sand beaches and coral reefs. The area includes 45 islands and islets with unique geological formations. While El Nido Town itself may not offer many activities, it boasts numerous restaurants and beach bars along the main beach where visitors can soak up the vibrant atmosphere.

sources.shortName: Top 10 Must-Visit Places in El Nido, Palawan

places.name: El Nido Beach

reviews.text:
In my opinion, El Nido is one of the prettiest towns. We were there for scuba diving. We stayed in town to have easy access to the dive centre, shops, restaurants, and the beach. We liked the beach very much. See the first photos. When the island hopping boats are gone, the beach is very quiet. Swimming is easy there. One must be careful when swimming if the boats are returning, but it's generally okay. The boats approach the shore carefully, disembark the guests, and immediately leave.
There are lots of other beaches around which are accessible from land or via island hopping tours. They are all beautiful. I must say I was pretty impressed with the El Nido beach. In the evenings, after dinner, it was nice to walk on the beach.
Full sunset, however, isn't observable from the beach due to the hill there. But no worries, nearby beach which everyone goes is great to enjoy the sunset.

These are not pictures of El Nido beach but of the tours, which are great.  The beach is swimmable once the boats leave and before they come back.  But a great area to find a cafe or bar overlooking the area for people watching.
So far so good, I haven't been for a swim yet, but maybe I'll go this week. Nice stretch of sand to walk along, a few bars and restaurants along the way.

places.generalDescription: Duli Beach, located in the northern part of Palawan, is a serene and spacious beach that offers a variety of activities such as surfing and sunbathing. It is known for its stunning sunset views and is popular among the surfing community in El Nido. Accessible via a rough road, this hidden gem charges a modest entrance fee but provides a peaceful escape with gentle waves suitable for novice surfers. While there are nearby restaurants, it's recommended to bring your own food for convenience.

sources.snippet: Located 10 minutes further north of Nacpan Beach, this is another beautiful white sand beach. This beach is not as popular and there is not a shuttle service here at present. You can book a private van transfer, rent a motorbike for the day or hire a tricycle to visit Duli Beach from El Nido Town.
sources.shortName: El Nido Philippines Travel Guide

sources.snippet: However, there were still nice small waves during our stay in April, which are particularly suitable for beginners. It is quiet on Duli Beach, and it has accommodation and three restaurants. Otherwise, the beach is deserted.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable places in El Nido

sources.snippet: Duli Beach is an unknown 2-kilometer-long white beach in the far northern tip of El Nido, Palawan. There is a 50 PHP (1 USD) entrance fee to the beach. No time to read now?
sources.siteName: Salt in our Hair Travel Blog
sources.shortName: 10 Best Things To Do in El Nido, Palawan (2025 Travel Guide)

sources.snippet: Duli Beach is about an hour out of El Nido Proper and serves up some serious surf. Expect no tourists and an undisturbed afternoon full of relaxing island vibes.
sources.shortName: 40 Awesome Photos of El Nido, Palawan

places.name: Duli Beach

reviews.text: Gorgeous and massive beach. Road can be a bit rough for access. MAKE SURE YOU FOLLOW SIGNS as Google maps currently takes you to Station One the private (and expensive) resort, instead of the public access to the beach.

Beautiful beach, not crowded but also you won't be alone.
High waves, so great for surfing üèÑ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

With sand that's more brownish than white, Duli Beach still manages to attract quite a lot of people for surfing and the general relaxed lifestyle. It's a very picturesque, coconut tree-lined beach, offering a laid-back vibe.

Although most parts of the beach feel quite secluded, there's a pretty decent choice of bars and restaurants at the northern tip.

places.generalDescription: Snake Island, previously called 'Vigan Island,' is a must-visit spot in El Nido. Situated in Bacuit Bay, this slender sandbar forms an S-shape and provides breathtaking views of the area. At low tide, visitors can stroll along the sandbar and encounter an array of stunning starfish and shells, making it a paradise for nature lovers and beach enthusiasts. It's a unique destination that offers an unforgettable experience for travelers exploring El Nido.

sources.snippet: This island is another great example of the beauty of El Nido. Look at the pristine beaches!. What makes Snake Island so special isn‚Äôt necessarily the island itself but the strip of sand leading up to it.
sources.shortName: Things To Do In El Nido Palawan Philippines

places.name: Snake Island sandbar

reviews.text: Great spot for chillin. Good stop for lunch in the middle of island hopping. Scenic view at the hill top
The highlight for Snake Island is the sandbar with small eave coming from two opposite directions and shallow sandy surrounding. Accessible by boat only. Not worth the visit as a solo attraction.
There is a small trail going up to see the island, which got its name because of the zigzag shape of the sandbank. Very pretty water colour and views when it's not crowded.

places.generalDescription: Helicopter Island, also known as Dilumacad, is a captivating destination in Bacuit Bay, El Nido. The island boasts lush limestone hills and unspoiled beaches that make it a must-see stop on island hopping tours. Its dramatic cliffs and verdant foliage are characteristic of the area's natural beauty. Visitors can enjoy the unique rock formations that give the island its name, resembling a helicopter from afar.

sources.snippet: Shaped like, you guessed it, a helicopter, this island looks remarkably like a giant helicopter sitting in Bacuit Bay. The island is home to a few nice beaches and is part of the El Nido Tour C day trip. There are also many dive trips that will take you to this part of the bay.
sources.shortName: Things To Do In El Nido Palawan Philippines

sources.snippet: ('em coconut trees! Hey, look! I'm in the Philippines!) Helicopter Island for a breathtaking view of iconic Cadlao Island, and Big Lagoon for it's Big...
sources.shortName: an Island Hopping Engagement Session in El Nido Palawan Philippines

sources.snippet: A kayak journey from El Nido to Helicopter Island ended with front row seats to the best show on Earth
sources.shortName: 40 Awesome Photos of El Nido, Palawan

places.name: Helicopter Island

reviews.text: Beautiful island! A lot of activities there. I accidentally left a pair of Flipper slippers there. If anyone found it, please let me know. üôè
White sand beach, but in water is big rocks, so swimming with waves can be difficult. Also someone lives in that beach. No toilet!
Fine, white sand beach, peaceful and serene. One of the stops of Tour C. Perfect place for swimming but not for lunch buffet/boodle flight since shaded areas are fewer.

places.generalDescription: Nacpan Beach is a true gem located just a scenic 45-minute drive from El Nido Town. This stunning stretch of coastline boasts soft, golden sands and crystal-clear waters, all framed by swaying palm trees that create an idyllic tropical atmosphere. Unlike many other beaches, Nacpan remains relatively uncrowded, allowing visitors to bask in its beauty without the hustle and bustle.

sources.snippet: We love all of the beaches, but Nacpan Beach is by far our favourite. The beach is long and beautiful, with lots of palm trees. It‚Äôs about a 45-minute drive from El Nido Town.
sources.siteName: Mik Simons - A journey of life
sources.shortName: 12 Awesome things to do in El Nido Philippines

places.name: Nacpan beach

reviews.text: Endless white sand beach. This is one of my favourite beaches we visited in El Nido. It's wide and long and flanked by palm trees. The water is clear and relatively shallow. If you walk 5 minutes down the beach from the parking area, you can get the whole place to yourself. The road is a bit rough down to the parking but was fine on our scooter. There are a number of bars and restaurants along the beach if you need sustenance.

It's a long beach, you can always choose a less crowded spot. I highly recommend combine restaurant just few steps from twin beach. It's less crowded plus their food is affordable!!! And you got a free sunbed!
One of my favorite beach!! You can just stay here all dayyy!

definitely the best beach in El Nido, in the morning you'll definitely get the beach for yourself, in the evening with clear sky you get the stunning sunset view. The place is quiet and far from town, the tricycle is about 1200php for a round trip from our hotel, we had the tricycle wait for us for about 4 hours. nice wave to play in the water, enough choices of restaurants.

places.generalDescription: Nestled amidst towering limestone cliffs and accessible only by boat, Secret Beach is a hidden gem frequented by tour boats. Snorkeling enthusiasts will revel in the underwater wonders of this secluded spot. Accommodation options abound, catering to various preferences and budgets in different neighborhoods like Caalan Beach, El Nido Town, Corong Corong Beach, Marimegmeg, and Nacpan. The local dining scene offers a diverse range of culinary experiences from seafood to vegan dishes.

sources.snippet: Being part of one of the more popular island hopping tour itineraries, unfortunately the Secret Lagoon and Beach isn‚Äôt much of a secret anymore. But it does remain a must-visit for good reason. Visitors have to swim through a small hole within the limestones‚Äìwhich at some hours of the day may be completely submerged under water‚Äìto get to the Secret Lagoon, and swim further down to get to the small sandy area considered the Secret Beach.
sources.shortName: The 10 Most Instagrammable Spots In El Nido Philippines

sources.snippet: Secret Beach is another must-visit spot that‚Äôs part of the El Nido Tour C island-hopping itinerary, the second most popular activity in the town next to Tour A. Often described as a hidden paradise, this beach is concealed behind towering limestone walls and can only be accessed by swimming or kayaking through a narrow opening. The dramatic entrance adds to the allure of Secret Beach, making it feel like a well-kept secret waiting to be discovered.
sources.shortName: 14 Best El Nido Town Tourist Spots & Things to Do in Palawan Island

sources.snippet: Matinloc Island, located in El Nido, is a treasure trove of stunning beaches, but the real gem of the island is the Secret Beach. Tucked away behind steep rock walls, this pocket of white sand is inaccessible by boat, making it an exclusive and must-see destination for beach enthusiasts. While not the easiest beach to reach, the journey to Secret Beach is well worth the effort.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Must-Visit Places in El Nido, Palawan

sources.snippet: By taking the C tour, you will see the most wonderful El Nido beach, the Secret. When the boat stops the engines, you will only see rock cliffs and a small crevasse in the middle of nowhere where the sea breaks. This crack is again a door to another surprising corner.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable places in El Nido

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre feeling adventurous, consider visiting the Secret Beach. Now this one is really true to its name because it is concealed by the cliffs. For you to see the Secret Beach, you have to swim through a crevice.
sources.shortName: El Nido Palawan 2022 Guide: Tourist Spots | Hotels

places.name: Secret Beach

reviews.text: This is another gem of the El Nido tour C. The rock formations and beaches are so cool. Our tourguide hurried us here, because he mentioned if the high tide comes, we can't get in or get out of this beach.

The beach is amazing, with stunning views of rocks, greenery, and absolutely beautiful water. Consider that since many people come here, the beach can get crowded. However, it would not minimise your appreciation of the setting.

On all 4 island hopping tours this for me was a standout, way better than secret lagoon and up there with small and big lagoons.

There is another secret part of secret beach where you can swim under some rocks and end up in a small 1m¬≤ chamber, a dome like structure that has sunlight coming in the top.

Not everyone can fit, but if you can go spend a minute in there and just relax, it was brilliant.

places.generalDescription: Experience the thrill of El Nido Via Ferrata Canopy Walk, also known as Taraw Cliff Canopy Walk, offering a stunning view of El Nido and its bay. The 20-minute hike takes you through limestone cliffs with stairs and a suspension bridge for an easy climb. Located near downtown El Nido, this quick morning activity provides fantastic views and can be booked in advance or on the day of your visit.

sources.snippet: Discover the best attractions in El Nido‚Äîfrom Big and Small Lagoons to hidden beaches, caves, and scenic viewpoints. A must-visit paradise in Palawan.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Must-Visit Places in El Nido, Palawan

places.name: El Nido Via Ferrata Canopy Walk

reviews.text: Really nice guided hike to one of the best overlooks of El Nido city and beach. Hike takes about 30 minutes round trip plus a stop at the top for pictures. You'll also cross a suspension bridge that adds an additional thrill. Well worth the visit if you're in El Nido and offers a nice contrast to the numerous beach boat tours.

Great view of the harbour, it's not a hard climb but you need some physical mobility as the start of the climb is steep over rocks and tree roots. There is a suspension bridge which rocks a bit but otherwise seems safe enough and you are tied in with a harness for this part. The rest is a staircase of scaffolding with open mesh flooring. If you are scared of heights the mesh flooring could be daunting but it seemed very stable. I would recommend it if you want to have a Birds Eye view of El Nido, great for a photo at the top.

Marketed as a via ferrata, but it's definitely more of a metal walkway than a real climbing route. Still, if you take it for what it is-an easy and structured canopy walk with a scenic viewpoint-it's a pleasant experience. I did it solo and found it to be a nice break from the usual boat tours. The first part is a bit steep and could be tiring if you're not in shape, but overall the trail is short and manageable. The view from the top is rewarding, and the whole activity takes about an hour. Not a must-do, but I don't regret it, worth it if you're looking for something different to do in El Nido.

places.address: 59HR+34P, Rizal St, El Nido, Palawan, Philippines

places.generalDescription: Star Beach, located on Tapiutan Island, is a secluded and privately owned white-sand beach with crystal-clear waters and abundant marine life. Although it's not included in some island-hopping tours due to high rates, it offers a serene atmosphere backed by impressive karst towers. This underrated destination provides an opportunity for visitors to enjoy the powdery white sands and azure waters without the crowds. It's also renowned for snorkeling, boasting a wide swimming area with thriving aquatic life underneath.

sources.shortName: 10 Most Instagrammable places in El Nido

places.name: Star Beach

reviews.text:
One of the best snorkeling spots. Crystal clear water and stunning panoramic view of limestones.

You won't be able to go to the beach because it's a private property.
What a stunning place. My boat tour stopped just next to Star beach to snorkel. It was amazing. A great number of fish and sea life. We also saw turtles. Best spot so far to snorkeling ü•∞
This is a private beach but you can go snorkeling there as part of Tour C package. Still beautiful as compared to the nearby beaches ‚ù§Ô∏èüòç

places.generalDescription: Entalula Island is an exclusive destination accessible to guests of the El Nido Resort. It boasts pristine beaches and excellent snorkeling opportunities. The island offers a tranquil ambiance, with white sand beaches and clear waters perfect for water activities. While more remote than surrounding islands, it provides a serene escape from the hustle and bustle of daily life. Visitors can enjoy the simple pleasures of wooden beach-beds and grilled dishes at the nearby bed and breakfast resort.

sources.snippet: Also a stop on Tour B, this island boasts a gorgeous beach and vibrant waters, like many others within Bacuit Bay. But what sets it apart is a striking, massive rock formation greeting its visitors as they approach its shores. Quiet and picturesque, Entalula is a great location to score some Insta-worthy shots.
sources.shortName: The 10 Most Instagrammable Spots In El Nido Philippines

sources.snippet: But if you're not willing to take the 40-minute trip north of El Nido town, just take a sunset cruise in El Nido bay, just a few clicks west of Miniloc and Entalula Island. Or choose El Nido Resort's Lagen or Pangulasian Islands. If you're staying in El Nido town, master the art of the chill (i.e., doing nothing without getting bored) over some tapas at Republica Sunset Bar, or practically anywhere along Corong-corong Beach.
sources.shortName: an Island Hopping Engagement Session in El Nido Palawan Philippines
23 Amazing Photos That Makes You Want To Visit El Nido, Palawan, Philippines 2021

places.name: Entalula Island

reviews.text:
If you book island hopping at El Nido, this island should be included in the trip. There is  a beach, sunbathing area, water shop and table (100 Php) for lunch.
The water is crystal clear and it is quite relaxing to stay here for 1-2 hours.
Absolutely stunning!! One of the best places we've seen in the world. Highly recommend visiting as part of the island hopping tour!
Amazing island! The most beautiful in Palawan

places.generalDescription: Lapus Lapus Beach is a hidden gem that promises an unforgettable experience for those seeking tranquility and natural beauty. Nestled near Corong Corong Beach, this stunning spot offers a serene atmosphere perfect for relaxation. Visitors can enjoy the picturesque views while lounging under trees or capturing memorable photos with the beach as a backdrop.

sources.snippet: This paradise beach is ignored by the tour groups and this leaves it to those who are happy to grab a kayak and paddle themselves there.
sources.shortName: The most Instagrammable places in the Philippines

places.name: Lapus Lapus Beach

reviews.text: Well who would expect such great encounters at this quiet beach! Clownfish and a sea turtle were waiting for us underwater! Bring your snorkeling gear when visiting. Been there at the end of April

Beautiful beach and with only few people as outside of the main tours. We reached by kayak from Corong Corong, easy 15min paddling to get there. You can snorkel here but no shack or anyone to rent it, so better come equipped if you intend to spend more time here. Otherwise, another 15min paddling to get to Papaya beach where there is someone selling drinks.

*PLEASE BRING DOGFOOD*

On the beach are two dogs who are (if i read the past reviews of this place on google review) not fed or taken care of üò£. We brought some food (you can find dogfood at the Drugman or the petstore!!) which they ate within seconds. They where very hungry. They are the sweetest dogs ever so please lets make sure together that they get enough food!!!

IMPORTANT NOTE: When dogs are not used to eating a lot you could kill them by feeding to much as there stomach is to weak for that. It's better to feed them small portions every hour / 2 hour!!
